all_reviews.review_title: SharpSpring allows our clients to dedicate more resources to content marketing.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
Let's get straight to the point: the best thing about SharpSpring is cost performance. When it comes to returning a robust marketing automation feature set at this price point, no other platform comes close.

Having worked as a Marketo partner for a few years and flirting on and off with Hubspot, I was blown away when I finally discovered SharpSpring. If you understand how to use marketing automation in a content marketing strategy, every critical feature and all of the flexibility of the other platforms is available in SharpSpring for a fraction of the cost.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
When you compare side by side, you will find that there are small features available in other platforms that you won't find in SharpSpring. But frankly, in my experience, the vast majority of these features apply to "edge use case" examples that will apply to a small minority of users at best, and, IMO, are foisted in the collateral and lauded by the sales reps more or less as a gimmick than an actual value add.

Are you surprised that a company with a name like Marketo is pretty good at marketing?

For example, if you're doing an evaluation, ask yourself if you really think you're going to use that Revenue Cycle Analytics system. I'm betting your marketing team has better ways to spend their time.

In a nutshell, sure, if your company has "more money than brains" and a dozen marketers with nothing better to do, Marketo was custom built for you. Or if you enjoy reading amazing marketing blog content and want to make a trip to Boston each year to see comedians and pop stars share their marketing expertise, Hubspot may just be the right fit. (You were wondering where your exorbitant "setup" fees are going?)

On the other hand, if you're actually focused on building content marketing programs and need a solid technology backbone to operate and monitor your campaigns that doesn't eat half your budget for breakfast, stop wasting your time, SharpSpring is the droid you've been looking for.

Of course, as a newer platform, SharpSpring does not yet have as many integrations available out of the box as the older platforms. This is something we'd all like to see and SharpSpring promises that they are always working on new integrations. There are, in fact, many existing third party integrations via Zapier, but you will still come across some marketing technologies that already connect to Marketo and Hubspot that aren't yet in the SharpSpring ecosystem. But that said, with the budget you save with an MA like SharpSpring, you can easily cover the cost of a custom integration if necessary.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
Do your homework. This comes down to feature set and price. When the sales team at the competitors tell you that this product "can't possibly be that good at that price," you can smirk to yourself knowing that they know that they've lost the sale.

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Having lots of anonymous visitors come to your website is nice, but not very useful to your sales team. Wouldn't it be nice to know the contact information of those visitors spending lots of time evaluating your products and services? Wouldn't it be nice if your primary sales problem was not finding new leads, but figuring out how to prioritize among the dozens of warm opportunities available in your pipeline?

Without great content, marketing automation is pointless. So the obvious math here is simple: the more money you spend on your marketing technology, the less spend you dedicate to your content. All things being equal, your technology needs to offer the feature set rich enough to operate your campaigns.  But beyond that, the determinative factors for your success are going to be based on the quality of the content you are offering, not on the useless bells and whistles in your technology stack.

B2B content marketing strategy is about developing intelligent content offers that actually return real value to your audiences. To create this kind of content, you need to have a deep understanding of how your value propositions solve your prospects' pain points. You also need to understand what kind of content works best for your audiences and how to get your content in front of those audiences.  And finally, you need a way to turn those anonymous audiences into known leads and a way to warm those leads with strategic messaging so your sales team can close more deals.

SharpSpring is the marketing technology we recommend to accomplish the last piece of that puzzle. But you will need a steady and persistent supply of high quality content to do effective marketing automation.  My job is to help my clients orchestrate and execute an intelligent strategy that combines both content and technology to deliver high quality marketing communications on a robust marketing technology backbone.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Interface, Customer Support Is Terrible
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
The interface is easy to use and visually appealing.  It doesn't take very long to get a handle on how to use the software and there are lots of support and training documents available in their partner portal.  The pricing model is great for agencies.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
They changed the way customer support operates several months ago. Previously you had an account rep who you could contact, now you just have to contact the general customer support which is terrible.  They rarely solve you problems and often times you have to contact them several times in order to get a response from them.  I have even contacted the head of agency support, who never responded back to me, so shows you were they are as far as support goes.  Email deliverability is also an issue, after a year, they still have no answers as to why so many emails don't get delivered.  I hope they clean up customer support and fix the many bugs in the software as it is a great service at a great price.  Reporting and analytics is very basic and sometimes fails to record properly.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
They tend to oversell the features with the software, some were not working when I signed up and others were in the process of being fixed.  It's good software at a great price, but be aware that there are lots of bugs still in the software and customer support can be infuriating to work with.  Most of my clients are small businesses, new to marketing automation, if you have clients with experience and more advanced needs, this may not be the software for you, I would ask very specific questions before buying.

Being able to connect all the dots from click to sale and making better marketing decisions based on this data.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
- The ability to better manage scheduling emails and follow-ups

- Cost-appropriate: we don't NEED a really comprehensive content management system, and therefore don't want to pay an astronomical amount for access to one. For what we are getting out of Sharpspring, it's very worth the cost.

- I find the landing pages builder to be a little lacking now (just hard to build/customize the way I would like), but they are moving in the right direction and I hope to eventually hope to be able to move off of leadpages to keep everything on SharpSpring.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
- For our business type (b2b, with some big customers but many, many small ones), the lead scoring/tracking leads really isn't that helpful.

- Customer Service could be better. They are generally responsive, but it can take a long time to actually resolve an issue - over a month for an integration issue.

- Customizing the look of forms (particularly for use embedded on various pages) is tough, and there are limitations to it.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
Evaluate your needs and determine how many tools you require. Think through your steps clearly: you get a lot of support during onboarding, but not a lot of direction, so you really need to have an outline to drive the conversations and trainings (and book your time in advance!).

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
- We have a new webinar program and are able to better manage the invitations and follow-up of that.

- We previously had very little segmentation of users, and are now better able to bucket our customers and prospects a little better to target them efficiently.

- We can better direct form-fills to the correct person on our side (this is not 100% accurate, as it is reliant on assigning a rep based on state and that occasionally has a delay in updating. However, it's *mostly* on point).

all_reviews.review_title: SharpSpring has nearly cost me my job. Twice.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
How affordable it is. The fact that we can cancel anytime was a BIG bonus for us. Thank god cancelling at any time is an option - you're gonna need it.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
Salesforce sync is in REALLY bad shape. Do not use SharpSpring if you need to sync to a CRM. Ever.

After some initial hiccups at the start that required extensive troubleshooting and fixing on the SharpSpring side, we finally got the sync working.  Then, after about 6 months, it stopped syncing all together.  It took close to 3 weeks for SharpSpring to figure out why.  If you're a marketer that is judged solely on the leads you pass to Sales, you understand why this is a showstopper.  Nearly cost me my job.

After that fiasco, they started charging me $100 a month for SF integration, with no warning or notice. By the way - it's in your contract that they can change their pricing at any time, for any reason, without notice. And they will - no matter what your sales person told you.

And now, as of this morning, I noticed that the Salesforce sync hasn't worked for almost 2 weeks. When I call support, they say "it's a known issue and we're working on it". If it's a known issue, why weren't customers notified?  Why does your support screen say 'All Systems Normal'?

If the Salesforce sync stays down for as long as it did last time, I will most likely lose my job.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
Don't do it!

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We didn't need all the features that Marketo provided, so we scaled way down with SharpSpring.  It is much more limited with lead processing and segmenting, so you kinda have to stick with the basics.

I haven't realized any bottom line benefits to using SharpSpring. It's a nightmare.

all_reviews.review_title: Great solution for agencies that work with SMBs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
As lead generation experts, we work with many different marketing automation solutions such as Eloqua, Pardot, Marketo, InfusionSoft. We are Certified HubSpot and SharpSpring Partners. Each solution works best depending upon the requirements and budget of the client. HubSpot is superior in functionality and ease of use for the end user, but at a higher price point. SharpSpring is a solid solution for agencies that work with small to mid-sized businesses that require a lower price point.

SharpSpring doesn't have the depth of functionality that other solutions have, but it has more breadth than point solutions such as Constant Contact, which is their sweet spot. SharpSpring provides a broad range of functionality at a reasonable price for businesses that may not otherwise be able to afford it.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
I think that SharpSpring's main drawback is on ease of use for the non-technical end user. As others have said, it can be glitch-y but so can every other marketing automation platform, especially in their youth (I'm old enough to remember when Salesforce was glitch-y).

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
For businesses that are looking at SharpSpring, understand your requirements and find a Certified Partner who can help you with discounts, implementation and be your go-to resource as needed. This will greatly lower your frustration (that is normal to feel with any marketing automation solution), improve your success rate and satisfaction.

SharpSpring is young, flexible and very responsive to feedback. They are an excellent choice for agencies looking for an agency-model.

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We focus on lead generation and increasing revenue for our clients across a variety of industries. For our clients that fit the target profile for SharpSpring we use it for:

- behavioral based automation
- visitor ID/prospect list
- dynamic content
- automated email nurturing
- lead scoring
- CRM (light functionality but exactly what our clients need and very easy to use)

SharpSpring does the same things higher priced solutions do for our clients (get more leads and more sales, increase loyalty, etc.), but at a price they can afford.

all_reviews.review_title: I came for customization, and that's what I got
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
I absolutely love that I can customize just about anything I want. Custom fields, custom triggers, custom filters,  etc. It really gives me the flexibility I need to fit SharpSpring into both the way we do business now and the plans I have for improvement and growth. I don't feel pigeon-holed or trapped because of the CRM we chose.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
I could use better reporting features. As they stand, the most useful reports pertain to campaigns. I would like to be able to draw out more reports based on my custom fields. Specifically, I'd like to customize the stages of a lead with a custom field and then pull a report based on that information. Currently, I can get that data in form of CSV files and manipulate it but that is an additional step.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
You're going to need to spend a lot of time to get set this up and truly realize the full compliment of benefits. I admittedly got overwhelmed doing it myself and had to bring in help from another department. I would recommend doing it in stage. Set up what you need to meet your current operations 1 for 1. Then move into all of the improvements and customizations that will really help your business take off. Their "guide" recommended this but it's hard to stick to when there's just so much you can do.

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
My company has 8 different physical locations so I am able to generate lists for each location, allowing them to get a nice concise view of their leads. We are able to see where leads came from, attribute them to campaigns through automation, and get a real cost per lead. Based on the behavior of leads (page views, email opens, etc.) we can then tailor both or email interactions and personal interactions.

I also made a make-shift customer support ticker tracker to assign support issues to the appropriate location. This has cut down on lost complaints. Lost complaints turn into escalated complaints and at that point customers are too angry to save and want a refund.

all_reviews.review_title: SharpSpring - the biggest bang for the buck
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
SharpSpring provides all the functionality my clients and I need most at a fraction of the cost of leading competitors. It does so in a user-friendly application with excellent self-help tools and support.

Before choosing SharpSpring, I was hands-on with Hubspot, Marketo, and Act-On and chose SharpSpring because of what I've written above and because it was much easier to learn and use than those platforms.

When I first  subscribed, there were a few features it was missing that I wished it had, but "settled" on SharpSpring based on a price/value decision. Lo and behold, over the last year they have added additional functionality including a couple of the key missing pieces and in doing so, technically reduced prices.

Need I say more?

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
They are growing so quickly that there have been glitches in account management and support. With that, things have settled down and support seems to be better than ever.

Additionally, there are times the application is slow but it is hard to tell where that "fault" lies. Regardless it hasn't caused major problems.

Email design can be a little clunky. When using our designs using built-in templates, the html doesn't always behave. I know it is something being worked on which sums SharpSpring up nicely, they are constantly listening and improving.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
Gather your requirements then demo at least 2 of the other high-end competitors, don't just allow a salesperson to sell you on something that may not work as promoted. The devil is in the details so regardless of what tools you may be interested in, use them first.

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use SharpSpring for my clients for inbound marketing campaigns.

With it we can quickly and easily create campaigns, optimize them, and track them.

With that, our most basic "drip" or follow-up communications are completely automated and customizable.

Sales data is relayed to the contact manager which can be integrated into CRMs, though it isn't necessary in many cases, and the pipeline tracking and sales automation resulting from this is also efficient and effective.

All told we are able to generate and track leads and optimize key communications channels for conversions.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful Marketing Automation Platform that Keeps Getting Better
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
It's a fairly intuitive interface, which is great. I didn't have any trouble figuring out how to use it. But when I do have problems, there is layer after layer after layer of help. Each layer gets progressively more detailed. On-screen help, then if that's not enough, extensive help videos. Then help documents which mirror the video so you can read & re-read. Then - if all that isn't enough, an easy-to-use, fast-response help ticket system. Oh, and they apparently continually update the help documents & videos. I say that because every time I check, they've added new documents. The help is deep AND wide. Pretty impressive given the paucity of help I've seen before in similar systems.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
If I want to trigger a work-flow, it has to occur AFTER some date/time. I'd like the option to trigger a workflow BEFORE a data/time as well.

This is a minor complaint. There's an easy way to do this, it just doesn't work the way I wanted it to.

Oh, one other thing. When I am doing follow-up calls from a LIST, I'd like the BACK button to take me back to the same place in the LIST, rather than take me back to the top of the LIST.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
Well worth the effort if you want to run automated email campaigns with lots of logic branches.

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sheesh! Marketing automation is such a giant beast to slay. We've automated our email contacts, so we can conduct multi-week email campaigns to a huge list, and - based on responses to the email - route our prospects into other campaigns. That all by itself is huge. It took some time to set it up, and a little time to maintain, but the amount of time this is saving is astonishing.

We've got lots of funnels with lots of landing pages, and it is amazing to be able to see who visited what page, and then trigger an email campaign based on that activity. I mean, one guy can do all this. Pretty cool.

all_reviews.review_title: SharpSpring is my marketing automation platform of choice.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
I have been in sales and content marketing since 1991 when I started a small consulting practice of my own. Yes, that was before the internet and my original CRM system was a really cool 3 x 5 Index Card system. We called this a Tickler file system. If you are old enough to remember this then you probably realize how fortunate we are to have companies like SharpSpring deliver such stellar software as a service for such an affordable price. (Sold to businesses almost exclusively through well-qualified value added consultants and resellers like me.)

What I like best is SharpSpring's commitment to their network of experience agency and consulting partners. Unlike Infusionsoft, Hubspot and many other companies, practically any "guru on a stage" can pitch marketing automation software as the solution de jour for "doubling sales" and "oh by the way, take our cool seminar and run this amazing software yourself!"

Not. Ever meet a business owner, sales or marketing pro who bought marketing automation software at a seminar or on any whim and was disappointed, if not devastated, to know what it would really take to make the marketing automation software perform, meaning they get an actual ROI? Precisely.

What I also like about SharpSpring is they don't pretend to be all things to all people. For example, SharpSpring does tell the world you can count on their software for huge CRM performance. This is why they make it super-easy, native integration, with CRM leaders who are the best in class for CRM like Salesforce and many other big guys.

SharpSpring can be an amazingly powerful, affordable SALES ENABLEMENT and marketing automation system that gives you serious ROI tracking at the campaign level. This is huge especially if you have a lean team and limited budget to drive ROI.


What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
There is nothing I really dislike. No software solution is perfect and neither is SharpSpring. You must select this kind of software carefully, and include your key players in the decision and implementation.

Other than this, SharpSpring is CRM light in my professional opinion, which is not a dislike as much as the same, simple truth that SharpSpring tells us ... "if you want serious CRM just integrate what works best for you with our SALES ENABLEMENT and marketing automation software." (That's actually my quote, but you get the gist of SharpSpring's intention to deliver killer software without being all things to all people.

I would like to see SharpSpring beef up a few of the CRM functions for list building, contact management, work flows, etc. And they are always open to our suggestions for raising the bar.


Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
The truth about all of these solutions for any performance beyond basic email marketing services is to choose wisely!

You must do your homework and understand the full cost and time horizon for implementing marketing automation and sales enablement software with higher probability of success for you and your team.

There are quite a few solutions on the market, and many more to come. Pick what is best for you, pay a professional to set it up quickly, effectively, to fit your and your team, your sales process and customer journey. Take the long view. Don't be cheap and wing it.

Make sure your entire team, all users, will be involved in the conversation about what they need to be happy doing their jobs, BEFORE you buy SharpSpring or any other marketing automation solution.

Feel free to reach me at Conversion Marketing Experts, LLC because I'm happy to offer you some insights to help you succeed.

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Well, consider reducing your ad budget by 85% while doubling the number of market qualified leads you produce for your sales team.

The biggest business problem I solve using SharpSpring is a single system to align sales, marketing, team and tech for sales and marketing ROI effectiveness. Sales and marketing is a team sport. The best teams use the solutions that fit them the best. And they hire and pay the best coaches to make sure their systems and people perform. Winning teams don't screw around.

I've helped over 300 companies since 2007 as one of the former, top-ten rated consulting partners with Infusionsoft before we parted ways.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
The price seems reasonable. Customers like the price too.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
Email reporting is inaccurate.
Email sync doesn't work properly.
Limited functionality -- it doesn't do everything they say it does.
User interface has room for improvement. Can't even sort the CRM by custom fields.
Support requests don't get solved.
I hasn't become a profit center. It has become a cost center in terms of time and money. We loose money on it every day.
We even moved our emails back to Constant Contact because it's more reliable.
Customer support are young and often don't know the product well enough to help.
Tech support never gets around to actually fixing inherent issues with the platform.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
It's great in concept. Execution is not good. I called several agency partners while I was vetting the product. The term young came up. Other than that, we didn't have a real grasp of the issues until we got our first client on line with it. We spent a great deal of time talking with SharpSpring about what's broken. They say they will fix it and never do. Before you resell it to a customer, use it for a few months to it's fullest extent. If your customer isn't very smart, technical or experienced they may think it's good. Others will jump ship pretty fasts. We have found that the email delivery rates are extremely low compared to Constant Contact. The CRM is nearly useless. The campaign tracking doesn't work well. The workflows and tasks are complicated to set up. It doesn't actual sync with emails. Only incoming -- not outgoing. They say it's easy to integrate with other systems because of their API. But when  you actually need to do it, they tell you they can't help. Every time I complain they just assign a new account rep to me. Apparently that's easier than actually making the application work properly. I've pulled two of their managers into the issues we've had as well. One of the issues they claimed to have solved, hasn't been solved. Support tickets that you file will likely not get addressed. We've had several sitting for months. Sometimes, they simply disappear.

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are reselling the product to customers. Other than having something new to sell, no problems have been solved. It creates problems.

SharpSpring makes it easy to get started quickly. Add a bit of javascript to a site, replace or map in your existing forms, and you can immediately start tracking visitors. Then, with their email marketing templates you can construct fairly complex workflows and automation tasks very quickly. My major complaint, which I repeat to them frequently, they don't communicate well about new features and additions. But they are getting better at it, so they know it's an issue.

We've seen good sized sales increases for our clients - which makes them very happy with us.  Even our sales team based clients have enjoyed SharpSpring's ability to qualify leads so they can target the best prospects while SharpSpring nurtures the lower scoring visitors.

all_reviews.review_title: A very powerful tool for marketing agencies with an extremely competitive/attractive pricing model
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
Beyond the functionality being good to excellent, I really like that the people behind SharpSpring really care about having the best product on the market,.  They are both responsive in providing excellent 1:1 support,  as well as open to receiving real world input  to improve product functionality.  Several of my requests have made it onto their roadmap, which is something you often don't experience with the "big guys".  Their use case and pricing model is designed for a services/consulting organization that monetizes on delivering outcomes to clients. While they are open to helping resell their services, there is no pressure to do so, nor is there any top down influence from sales to resell their services to my clients, nor is there any channel conflict if their direct sales teams going after my clients.  My success is their success, i.e, as add clients we both win.  Finally, they really have a very attractive price point that is second to none, especially when compared to their competitors.

What do you dislike about Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform?
None really.  I'm willing to be more patient with them as they are an emerging company that will only get better over time in providing both a more robust platform, as well as offering unique capabilities that are not found on more expensive competitive offerings.  i would like to have some of their dialogue messages be triggered and sent via email rather than just appear on the screen.  For e.g., when a job is submitted, I'd like to receive an email that says "your job for XYX has been submitted and is successfully loading and will be sent in XX minutes.  I'd also like to receive updates on fixes and enhancements on a weekly basis.  Any other criticisms at this point would be somewhat nit picky.  I give them the benefit that they will do the right thing.

Recommendations to others considering Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform:
Know your use case for choosing a marketing automation or email marketing platform.  Our unique use case for marketing automation was the most important factor for choosing SharpSpring.  Since our primary use case is email marketing to drive & optimize webinar registrations, the functionality it provides is spot on,  Our reputation is on the line with each client, so we can't afford to use just any platform.  Their pricing model is perfect for an agency type of service business such as ours.  It also integrates with GoToWebinar & WebEx, which is core to what we do.  Next is the skill level required to operate the platform and ramp up time to become proficient.  I'm not that technical so I needed to be self sufficient with how the solution performs as well as identifying any weaknesses.  It was very easy and somewhat intuitive to learn. The support offered was next on my list, as having someone responsive to call  "on-demand" was a must.  The pricing model which is based on the # of emails sent per billing period vs. how many contacts in the database was an important criteria. So far, I'm quite pleased with our decision.  They really care about  their partners, and are open to suggestions to enhance the platform.  I look forward to unlocking more of the potential and cool features that SharpSpring provides us and our clients to be successful.

What problems is Constant Contact Advanced Automation & CRM Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are a full services webinar production organization with single vendor responsibility, and are hired by B2B brands and media publishers as their outsourced webinar production partner.  We are on the line to produce and deliver polished webinars to help them achieve their demand generation goals.  Our responsibilities include acquiring, engaging and converting audiences to become their clients. Audience acquisition via email marketing is a must have deliverable, and SharpSpring provides us the platform to successfully execute campaigns that meet or exceed our client's webinar registration targets.
